page.title: 04Education in Longhope
page.content: Our school is Longhope C.ofE. (controlled) Primary School. It has, in 1985,65 children aged 4-11 years arranged in three classes.It was originally built as a National School in 1829 and the buildings lie within the Rectory grounds.The canteen building was a converted stable. When the village population grew in the '70's two terrapin classrooms were built at the edge of the playground. Following the death of the Rector in 1982 the Rectory was sold and the orchard behind the school was altered to provide us with a playing field. At 11 years of age all children will transfer to a new 11-16 Comprehensive School at Mitcheldean called Dene Magna,opening in September 1985 on the premises of the Abenhall Secondary Modern School.
